H0.text: Hot and dry is the type of climate that would provide the slowest rate of chemical weathering for a marble statue, satisfying the citizens' desire to place it in a climate with a slow rate of chemical weathering.

H1.text: Cold and dry climates are the best type of climate to place a marble statue built by a group of citizens, providing the slowest rate of chemical weathering.

H2.text: Hot and humid is the type of climate that would be best for a group of citizens who want to place a marble statue in a climate with the slowest rate of chemical weathering.

H3.text: Cold and humid is the type of climate a group of citizens would choose to place a marble statue in order to achieve the slowest rate of chemical weathering.
